description.en: Texts that introduce main discipline of religious studies and theology will be read and analyzed.
description.et: Kursusel loetakse ja analüüsitakse tekste, mis tutvustavad teoloogia ja religiooniuuringute põhidistsipliine.

objectives.en: The aim is to familiarize students with the main concepts and issues in religious studies and theology and to read selected texts.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvuda teoloogia ja religiooniuuringute põhimõistete ja põhiküsimuste ning omandada nende tekstide kriitilise lugemise oskus

learning_outcomes.en: Having passed the course, the student analyzes basic texts of theology and religious studies, can write an abstract and is familiar with the basic terminology of religious studies and theology.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpetamisel õppija analüüsib lihtsamaid teoloogilisi ja religiooniuuringute tekste, teeb neist lühikese kokkuvõtte ning tunneb põhilist ingliskeelset erialast sõnavara

independent_work.et:
Reading the set of texts - one for each seminar
Submitting homework in seminar or to Moodle (your own questions and  written answers to questions about the text)
Two presentations

description.et: Reading and translating a paper for each seminar, oral and written answer to the questions given in moodle, participation in discussions
Short summary (about 5-10 minutes) of two texts. What was the main problem? What were the difficulties in understanding the text?
Use the words in the right context. Explain the meaning of central vocabulary in theology and religious studies. To pass you have to get at least 70%. The test can be done in two parts.

grade_preconditions.et:
To pass the course 
- Read the text carefully for each seminar!
Participate in the seminars, bring the text and your homework with you every time! 
Present two papers orally! The topic needs to be agreed upon with the lecturer. It is possible to get feedback to the first version of you presentation if you present it one week before.

grade_evaluation.et: Participation in the seminars, homeworks, two oral presentations. Test of the vocabulary at least 70%

debt_elimination.et: If the student misses a seminar: Please send  answers to the questions posted in moodle at least before the next seminar!.

description.et: Introduction. Horace Miner. Body Ritual among the Nacirema

Psychology of Religion: Raymond F. Paloutzian. Invitation to the Psychology of Religion
Sociology of Religion: Eileen Barker. The Scientific Study of Religion? You Must Be Joking!
Non-Religion: Steve Bruce. Late Secularization and Religion as Alien
Anthropology of Religion. Godula Kosack. The Reality of Witchcraft
Islam: Michael Cook. Islam and Identity
